subject: Bwaaahhh
event:
Life is meaningless and full of pain.

Great game.  Bad ending.

Sanchez and the offense played great.  But the vaunted Jets defense must have taken the wrong plane.  The one that took the field made The Other Chad look like Dan Marino.

First time I've seen the wildcat up close and personal.  Seven bloody hells.  We couldn't stop the damn thing all night.  

Someone give Ricky Williams a reefer, quick.

On the good side, hey, I'm liking that Braylon Edwards trade a lot more than I did a few weeks ago.

comments.article: First game I've seen all season and it was a doozy! That Ted Ginn TD catch was a thing of beauty. On a more general note, still a shock for me to see the Tuna on our side of the field. As for the coverage, having the play clock run down in the graphic on the grass is very cool :->

I thought the Braylon Edwards and David Clowney catches were more beautiful, myself. Funny how that works.

Do you get your own announcers, or do you listen to the ESPN crew? Gruden is very good, I think, but Jaws is so damn annoying. I much prefer the Sunday night team with Michaels and Collingsworth. And I miss Madden.

Miami's offense is ridiculously good. Other than the game Peyton Manning won because he's the best of the Mannings, the Dolphins look good.

Sure they lost to ATL, but it was the first game of the season or some other excuse.

Either way, they're beasting right now on the ground, killing your G-Men as far as rushing leaders.

Ya gotta admit it was a good game though, I was rooting for the jets cause thats your team, but like I said, it was a good game..Looking forward to seeing more of Sanchez, very dynamic player, and I think at the end there the dolphs shoulda got an intentional grounding on them, but thats football, some good plays on both sides, exciting till the end
comments.subject: Good game

comments.article:
I'm not surprised Braylon Edwards played well. It just doesn't make sense to go from great one year to bad butterfingers the next. I don't think you can put all the blame on the player. Have to wonder if it's partially QB and coaching. Edwards was a first round pick and is young, I think you'll find he was worth it. It's a good trade for him too though, I don't know how Derek Anderson managed to go from rising star to 2/17, but he did, and Quinn hasn't been much better.

I like Ricky Williams quite a bit actually. If it wasn't for a retarded backwards policy on pot, he might of been a hall of fame candidate.

If it's any consolation I have a good chance of being sad next week if the Vikings lose to Baltimore. Revel in the future Schadenfreude.

Of course my far-fetched hope is the Vikings vs. Giants both 15-0 in week 17.

Oh, and just looked it up, Chad Henne was the 4th QB taken in the '08 draft, so it's not like he doesn't have talent and upside.
comments.subject: Foosball

comments.article: Jets are hopeless George. Giants, on the other hand, are very very good. Being a 20 year Cowboy fan, I hope they can get something together, though it looks grim with Wade in charge. At least we have a receiver now, and it looks like Demarcus Ware is getting his game back on.
comments.subject: Cowboys

comments.article: Teams Cowboys have beaten combined record: 1 and 13
comments.subject: Re: Cowboys

comments.article: I don't think we talk about football enough!

On another note I have to say ,you guys are doing an excellent job on the actors for the pilot, most of them so far are dead on (imo) at least looks wise. After its all said and done it will be cool to see a making of documentary if at all possible (maybe with some author commentary)
Mr. Martin I was wondering if it will be possible to get signed books when you do a book signing here in the U.S. if I call ahead to the book store? (like you were talking about in Ireland)Thanks
comments.subject: on another note

comments.article:
Classic monday night game. Amazing. Edwards played well for the Jets. But for me the thing was the Dolphins haven't gotten any respect. Finally people have to show the Dolphins some. Chad Henne had 130.4 passer rating with 241 yards and 2 td's with no picks! The Dolphins ran the ball at will. A darn good game. Go Phins! Take that respect!

George, at least you have an amazing Giants team to cheer for. Great game can't wait for the Saints-Giants game!

What a pleasure it is, to see the 'phins beat the Jets. Smells like victory.

I'm surprised Rex Ryan couldn't do a better job preparing the defense against the wildcat, given that the Ravens shut it down completely when he was their defensive coordinator. Pretty significant weakness that's been revealed, and I kind of wonder whether anyone else is going to try to exploit it; a lot of teams have it in their playbook, but not so many practice it as assiduously as the Dolphins.

Next up for Miami is New Orleans. That ... doesn't sound so good. Maybe the Giants will wreak havoc on their moral and leave them a broken shell of a team when the Dolphins come along.

Here's hoping.

As much as I like to bash Antonio Pierce, the one thing the Giants D has in him which many teams don't is a true field general. He has the uncanny ability recognize weaknesses and to work with the coaches to adjust the game schemes. Now if someone can transplant his brain into a younger faster body...

The Rex Ryan defense needs a field general. But, maybe Rex is like Tony LaRussa who demands on calling the game from the bench. I hope not. From his interviews, it doesn't sound like it.
...USC could've won the BCS last year...Sanchez was a monster.  He reminded me of Montana in his prime.
BTW, thought these adjusted logos for NFL teams after the first couple of weeks of the season were fairly amusing :->

"Life is meaningless and full of pain"

Could be worse... You could be a redskins fan. We've been beaten this year by 2 undefeated teams... Carolina and FLIPPING DETROIT.

It's enough to make me want to change the channel to romantic comedies!

I love Braylon with a fiery passion.  (UM Football fan, here).  Really, when he gets comfortable with the team?  Man can catch ANYTHING.  Doesn't even have to be thrown to him--the general vicinity is sufficient.

If I heard the announcers say, "WILDCAT" one more time, I would not have been responsible for my actions. Gadzooks! Like kids with a new toy.

Sanchez/Edwards=great pairing. Our defense might have sucked last night, but after a rough start (on Sanchez's part) we did pretty damn fine offensively.
As a Browns fan just let me say this, before its all said and done Braylon will break your heart

Granted, the Cowboys wins have come against weak opponents, but our two losses were a last-second field goal loss to the Giants in a game we dominated (and would have won if we kept the ball on the ground), and a 1 score loss to the Broncos in a game without our biggest offensive weapon (and before Austin's emergence).  And by the way, both the Giants and Broncos are undefeated.
comments.subject: Cowboys

comments.article: I remember when the Pats were on the wrong end of that Wildcat offense last year.  It was awful - just humiliating.  But the second time they faced the Dolphins, they were prepared and broke the Wildcat.  Hopefully your boys get their act together and do the same later in the season.

Always interesting how new formations are met by new defenses - but then sometimes mutate.

In the 60's teams tried the shotgun but then it fell out of favor suposedly "exposed" by the Bear defense (at least that's what a mid-60s NFL book I had called the 20 most important games (or something) said).

Then the shotgun reappears and becomes a standard formation (even in 3rd and short!).

Dolphins have at least shown willingness to inovate even using spot QB on critical serias. Maybe Wild cat has mutated beyond first defensive responses. Someone may need to study how they finally stopped the single wing. "Whos got that Red Grange film!" - overheard in Giants locker room.

TomT
comments.subject: Wildcat

comments.article: I am a big dolphin fan, so I am excited about the game. I am from Iowa and a Iowa Hawkeye fan, the jets picked up a great running back (green) and didnt play him enough. Maybe, just maybe, thats why the dolphins won. lol
comments.subject: Dolphins

comments.article: At least it was a good game.  The niners stunk it up all day.  And that number 4 ranked defense of ours?  Nonexistent.
I can't wait for my team(the Vikings) to play the Giants. That has the makings of an epic end of the year game(or not, with both teams sitting out most of their stars for the post season).
comments.subject: Roll On...

comments.article:
Hes not bad, but he isn't the QB messiah either. After watching the Jets Dolphins game (not an impartial observer - go Dolphins!), I was a little disappointed in Sanchez. His range wasn't that good, he went deep and he went short, very little mid range passing. And against a team that has corners and safeties that can stop a deep pass he wouldn't do as well. I also heard the commentators mention that he tends to give 'looks' to his intended receivers, making him easier to read.

Without that dreadful 49yd pass interference call, the two ridiculous personal fouls penalties, and the 2 punt fakes (who does it twice!?), then the Jets offence really weren't in it.

Yes, Braylon Edwards looked good. No doubt, he's got hands, speed and ability.

Now, Chad Henne, he is looking good, has it all, and is improving. If I had to pick a rookie QB this year, its not Sanchez.
comments.subject: Really, Sanchez?

comments.article:
I'd have to agree with you. Henne looks sound. He should. He's been a starting QB since his freshman year.

Sanchez is no slouch. I expect that he will have marked improvement by the end of the season. That is, if he's not hiding an injury.
comments.subject: Re: Really, Sanchez?

comments.article: Well, it didn't work out in your favor, but you have to admit it was a nail-biter. At least it made for an exciting Monday Night Football game...
comments.subject: Monday Night Football

comments.article:
You had to like the irony of the game.

You had a Miami team, with a MICH QB, throwing TD bombs to a BUCKEYE WR.
comments.subject: Great Game - sorry for your loss

comments.article: I didn't even ask my SO how the Skins game went, and he didn't say anything about it, so I kind of figured it was a lost cause. I'm so done with that team. Can I join your side? I have a serious crush on Eli if that counts for anything.
By all means.  Come to the Blue... the Blue is true... we are all happy in the Blue...

On the good side, hey, I'm liking that Braylon Edwards trade a lot more than I did a few weeks ago.

A few weeks ago?

The trade only happened last week!
